required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcome of Arthroscopic Lateral Release for Lateral Patellar Compression Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcome of Arthroscopic Lateral Release for Lateral Patellar Compression Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: We performed a prospective case series study of 48 patients who suffered Lateral patellar compression syndrome who were diagnosed by clinical examination and confirmed by M.R.I. and failed conservative management and underwent isolated arthroscopic lateral patellar retinaculum release in Erbil Teaching Hospital, PAR Private Hospital and Hawler Private Hospital between December 2016 and August 2019.

primary_outcome.description: Eight sections are assessed to produce an overall score on a scale of 0 to 100. Then an assignment is given as "excellent" for 95 to 100 points; "good" for 85 to 94 points, "fair" for 65 to 84 points, or "poor" for less than 65 points

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lateral patellar compression syndrome proved by clinical,MRI and Arthroscopic examination
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Dislocated or history of dislocation.
2. Patellar instability.
3. Bony abnormality (trochlear groove hypoplasia or flat).
4. Osteoarthritis of the knee 3rd and 4th grades.
5. Infected knee.
6. Varus and valgus knee.
7. Rotational deformity of the lower extremity.
8. Miserable malalignment triad.
9. Anterior cruciate ligament, posterior cruciate ligament and medial collateral ligament rupture.
10. History of fracture around knee.
11. Focal Osteoarthritis of the lateral facet joint.
12. Chondral lesion (Outerbridge 3 and 4).
